item.title: 科多公司的倒塌可能是采矿造成的，而非自然原因
item.description: 据一位直接了解此事的人士称，导致智利最大矿山 Codelco 发生致命坍塌的地震事件很可能是由采矿活动而非自然造成的。【原文：The seismic event that caused a fatal collapse at Codelco’s biggest mine in Chile is likely to have been caused by mining activity rather than nature, according to a person with direct knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普的环保局取消了对太阳能项目的 70 亿美元资助
item.description: 特朗普政府取消了一项由环境保护局管理的价值 70 亿美元的太阳能补助计划。【原文：The Trump administration canceled a $7 billion grant program for solar energy administered by the Environmental Protection Agency.】

item.title: 通用汽车将向中国 CATL 购买电动汽车电池，用于生产低成本的 Bolt 电动汽车
item.description: 通用汽车公司计划从中国购买电动汽车电池，为其即将推出的入门级电动汽车提供动力，直到通过与韩国 LG Energy Solution 公司的合作关系采购到美国制造的电池为止。【原文：General Motors Co. plans to purchase electric-vehicle batteries from China to power its upcoming entry-level EV until it can procure US-made batteries through its partnership with South Korea’s LG Energy Solution.】

item.title: 在公众的强烈抗议声中，法国最高法院宣布杀虫剂法无效
item.description: 法国宪法法院宣布一项有争议的新法律中允许使用违禁杀虫剂的条款无效，此举引起了公众的广泛抗议。【原文：France’s constitutional court invalidated provisions of a controversial new law that would have allowed the use of a banned pesticide, a move that had prompted a widespread public outcry.】

item.title: 法国葡萄种植者称火灾给葡萄园造成巨大损失
item.description: 法国南部发生了 70 多年来最严重的大火，几乎可以收获的葡萄树遭到了灾难性的破坏。【原文：French wine makers have seen catastrophic damage to vines that were almost ready to be harvested after the worst fires in more than 70 years burned through the south of the country.】

item.title: 热穹即将测试美国西南部的气温记录
item.description: 本周，凤凰城和美国西南部将出现极端高温天气，气温将创下历史新高，约 750 万人将笼罩在闷热的高压穹顶之下。【原文：Extreme heat will sear down across Phoenix and the US Southwest this week, testing temperature records and putting about 7.5 million people under a sweltering high-pressure dome.】

item.title: 一些常见药物有鲜为人知的副作用
item.description:
服用某些药物治疗心脏病、过敏症和其他疾病的人患热病的风险较高。【原文：

Those taking certain drugs to treat heart diseases, allergies and other maladies are at a higher risk of heat-related illness.

】

item.title: 风险管理是正在崛起的十亿美元商机
item.description: 今天的时事通讯将带您前往德克萨斯州，那里的风险管理专业人士刚刚召开会议，讨论该行业数十亿美元的机遇。另外，能源部长克里斯-赖特（Chris Wright）一直在兜售其机构近期报告中的误导性结论。如需无限获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter takes you to Texas, where risk management professionals just convened to discuss the billion-dollar opportunity for the industry. Plus, Energy Secretary Chris Wright has been touting misleading findings from his agency’s recent report. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 特朗普的最新攻击震惊了风能和太阳能产业
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统对风能和太阳能的攻击正从口头上升级到实际行动上，发起了一场超出风能和太阳能行业最担心的速战速决运动。在过去短短几周内，特朗普政府实施了威胁美国风能和太阳能开发的许可审查。 它实施的标准从根本上阻止了在联邦土地上进行新的开发。它废除了拜登时代将沿海水域指定为未来风力涡轮机专用水域的决定。本周三【原文：President Donald Trump is escalating his attacks on wind and solar power from the rhetorical to the tangible, mounting a rapid-fire campaign that exceeds the industries’ worst fears.In just the past few weeks, the Trump administration instituted permitting reviews that threaten US wind and solar developments. It imposed standards that would essentially prevent new developments on federal land. It rescinded Biden-era decisions earmarking coastal waters for future wind turbines. And on Wednesday】

item.title: 在华尔街和英国退出后，瑞银退出净零银行俱乐部
item.description: 继华尔街和英国银行相继离职后，瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）是最新一家宣布离开全球最大气候集团的银行。【原文：UBS Group AG is the latest bank to announce it’s leaving the world’s biggest climate group for the industry, following a string of departures by Wall Street and UK banks.】

item.title: 法国消防员奋力控制 1949 年以来最严重的大火
item.description: 随着风速降低，大火的强度减弱，法国消防员用第三天的时间扑灭了该国七十多年来最严重的野火，希望能在周五之前控制住火势。【原文：French firefighters spent a third day tackling the country’s worst wildfire in more than seven decades, hoping to bring it under control by Friday as lower wind speeds reduce the intensity of the blaze.】

item.title: 气候影响 GDP 62% 的研究遭到同行批评
item.description: 科学家们对一项旗舰研究的结果提出了质疑，该研究计算出严重的气候变化可能使本世纪全球经济增长减少约 62%，该研究结果已被政策制定者和中央银行广泛引用。【原文：Scientists have challenged the findings of a flagship study that calculated severe climate change could cut global growth by about 62% this century, and which has been widely cited by policymakers and central banks.】

item.title: StanChart 与巴西阿克里州签署碳信用额协议
item.description: 渣打银行（Standard Chartered Plc）与巴西西部的阿克里州（Acre）达成了一项协议，出售其所称在未来五年内通过保护部分亚马逊雨林而产生的碳信用额度。【原文：Standard Chartered Plc has entered a deal with Acre, a state in western Brazil, to sell carbon credits it says will be generated by protecting part of the Amazon rainforest over the next half decade.】

item.title: 英国开始关键风电拍卖，成本将上升
item.description: 英国开放了最新的海上风电补贴拍卖申请，政府正努力确保足够的发电能力，以便到 2030 年实现无碳电网。【原文：The UK opened applications for the latest offshore wind subsidy auction as the government tries to secure enough capacity to make it possible to run a carbon-free electricity grid by 2030.】

item.title: 创纪录高温笼罩日本，石破茂誓言采取健康行动
item.description: 日本首相石破茂（Shigeru Ishiba）承诺加强公共卫生保护，因为日本正在应对严重的热浪，最近几天全国气温记录已两次被打破。【原文：Japan’s Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba pledged to boost public health protections as the country grapples with a severe heat wave that has seen the national temperature record broken twice in recent days.】

item.title: 富裕国家如何再次廉价建设核电
item.description:
核科学家、风险投资公司DCVC合伙人雷切尔-斯莱博（Rachel Slaybaugh）在零点节目中解释了为什么核能已成为中国的又一个成功故事。【原文：

Rachel Slaybaugh, nuclear scientist and partner at venture capital firm DCVC, joins Zero to explain why nuclear has become another China success story. 

】

item.title: 贝莱德的 GIP 据称将为东南亚基础设施招聘人才
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，贝莱德公司旗下的私人市场公司 Global Infrastructure Partners LP 正在组建一个团队，为东南亚的基础设施项目融资，这些项目通常很难获得投资。【原文：Global Infrastructure Partners LP, a private markets firm that’s a unit of BlackRock Inc., is setting up a team to finance infrastructure projects in Southeast Asia that usually struggle to secure investment, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 克里斯-赖特吹捧能源部报告的误导性气候声明
item.description:
报告认为气候变化不会影响极端天气，这一结论与主流科学和越来越多的现实证据相悖。【原文：

The report’s conclusion that climate change isn’t influencing extreme weather is at odds with mainstream science and a growing body of real-world evidence.

】

item.title: 华尔街发现石油和天然气客户交易量下降
item.description: 今天的时事通讯关注化石燃料项目贷款的减少。此外，我们还将独家报道特朗普政府扼杀的一个重要联邦数据库的回归。如需不受限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at the decline in lending for fossil fuel projects. Plus, a scoop on the return of a key federal database that the Trump administration killed. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 猎杀犀牛和大象的僵局导致价值 35 万美元的南非野生动物园停业
item.description: 一个行业游说团体表示，南非环境部在过去五年中一直没有发放大象、花豹和黑犀牛的战利品出口配额，这导致每次费用高达 35 万美元的狩猎之旅被迫停止。【原文：The South African environment ministry’s failure to issue trophy export quotas for elephant, leopard and black rhinos for the last five years has halted hunting safaris that cost as much as $350,000 each, an industry lobby group said.】

item.title: 特朗普取消爱达荷州大型风电场，可再生能源前景堪忧
item.description: 特朗普政府正在取消爱达荷州的一个大型风能项目，这是在总统寻求在全国范围内推动化石燃料发展的背景下，对美国风能产业的又一次打击。【原文：The Trump administration is cancelling a massive wind project in Idaho, another blow to the the US wind industry as the president seeks to propel fossil fuel development nationwide.】

item.title: 德国商业银行预留 3.13 亿美元应对关税和气候风险
item.description: 德国商业银行（Commerzbank AG）已预留 2.7 亿欧元（3.13 亿美元）的准备金，作为新缓冲区的一部分，旨在吸收与美国贸易政策和气候变化影响相关的损失。【原文：Commerzbank AG has set aside €270 million ($313 million) in provisions as part of a new buffer intended to absorb losses tied to the fallout from US trade policies and climate change.】

item.title: 热浪来袭，致命野火肆虐法国西南部
item.description: 野火肆虐法国南部的葡萄园和农场，造成一人死亡，数以千计的家庭被大火烧断道路和电源，居民被迫逃离。【原文：Wildfires ravaged vineyards and farms in southern France, leaving one person dead and forcing residents to flee as flames shut roads and cut power to thousands of homes.】

item.title: M&M公司转向基因编辑，以确保可可供应
item.description: 玛氏公司正在利用基因编辑技术，加快培育更坚韧的可可植物；这是该公司为确保这种重要作物持续供应所做努力的一部分。【原文：Mars Inc. is tapping gene-editing technology that could speed up the development of hardier cocoa plants — part of the company’s efforts to ensure continued supplies of the crucial crop.】

item.title: 德国零补贴海上风电拍卖无人竞标
item.description: 德国的一次海上风电拍卖在无一竞标的情况下结束，这表明零补贴合同并不受投资者欢迎。【原文：An offshore wind auction in Germany ended without a single bid, showing that zero-subsidy contracts are not in demand with investors.】

item.title: 亚足联称非洲关键矿产是推动清洁能源发展的关键
item.description: 非洲金融公司（Africa Finance Corp）总裁表示，非洲在全球向清洁能源转型过程中的作用应集中于增加转型所需的关键矿产供应，而不是减少其自身微不足道的排放量。【原文：Africa’s role in the global pivot toward cleaner sources of energy should focus on increasing the supply of critical minerals needed to make the transition, rather than on reducing its own negligible emissions, according to the president of the Africa Finance Corp.】

item.title: 波兰能源部长认为煤炭在气候变暖中仍有发展前景
item.description: 波兰新任能源部长表示，他支持以温和的方式实现该国的气候目标，允许在 2040 年仍使用一些燃煤发电厂。【原文：Poland’s new energy minister said he supports a moderate path to meet the country’s climate ambitions, allowing some coal-fired power plant to still be used in 2040.】

item.title: 澳大利亚必须改革清洁能源投资市场：报告
item.description: 随着电网波动的加剧，一个独立专家小组敦促澳大利亚采取全面的电力市场改革，以释放对清洁能源的长期投资，并改善对冲工具的使用。【原文：A panel of independent experts has urged Australia to adopt sweeping electricity market reforms to unlock long-term investment in clean energy and improve access to hedging tools, as grid volatility intensifies.】

item.title: 英国热泵广告因误导性宣传被禁
item.description:
两家主要的安装公司被告知，在未充分了解谁有资格获得政府补贴的情况下，不得再发布广告。【原文：

Two major installers have been told not to run their ads again without full information about who is eligible for government subsidies.

】

item.title: 研究人员正在复活被特朗普扼杀的价值数十亿美元的灾难工具
item.description:
非营利组织 "气候中心 "聘请了昂贵的天气灾害关键数据库背后的科学家重建该数据库。【原文：

Nonprofit Climate Central has hired the scientist behind a key database of costly weather disasters to rebuild it.

】
